intro: Chenopodium neumanii, commonly known as desert goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often on rocky soils or in desert scrub habitats. Its leaves are usually oval or rhombic in shape and can vary in color from green to reddish. Chenopodium neumanii is often used in traditional medicine by indigenous peoples for its purported health benefits.
